lines.text: You were wonderful tonight.
Yeah, I'm always wonderful at night.
Tonight, you were especially good.
Well... When I'm good, I'm very good. But, when I'm bad...
[winks at Jack]
I'm better.
It's not the men in your life that counts, it's the life in your men.
Tira,I've changed my mind.
Does it work any better.
By the way, honey, you married or single?
Married five times.
Five times? Wedding bells must sound like an alarm clock to you.
I see a man in your life.
What? Only one?
Beulah, peel me a grape.
What do you do for a living?
Oh, uh, sort of a politician.
I don't like work either.
"Take all you can get and give as little as possible". Don't forget, honey. Never let one man worry your mind. Find 'em, fool 'em and forget 'em!
Do you mind if I get personal?
Hmmm, go ahead. I don't mind if you get familiar.
I like to get around and travel; and, believe me, I've been places and seen things.
Mmm-hmm. I've been things and seen places. That sort of evens us out.
Oh I'm crazy about you.
I did my best to make you that way.
Look darling, you need a rest, and so do I. Let me take you away somewhere, we'll...
Would you call that a rest?
What are you thinking about?
Same thing you are.
[after he reads her fortune, Rajah gives Tira the horoscope he has prepared for her]
Keep this where you may consult it frequently.
Alright, I'll take it to bed with me.
Am I making myself clear, boys?
[in low voice]
Suckers.
I see a change of position.
Sitting or reclining?
I'll see you later.
the later the better.
never let one man worry your mind... find 'em, fool 'em, and forget 'em.

[to Slick Wiley]
What'd you do? Get your hair cut or have your ears moved down?
You were born in August.
Yeah, one of the hot months.
Come on, can't you hurry up and get that thing fixed? I gotta get back. I'm expecting Mr. Clayton at the apartment.
I'm doing the best I can, ma'am.
Yeah, your best is no good. Try doing your worst.
Yes, ma'am.

[Answers phone]
Hello? Oh, Juror #4. Yes, I remember you. You were the one with the nice kind face. Mmm hmm. Oh, I know you were for me. Mmm hmm. I want to thank you for those beautiful flowers. They were lovely. And don't forget - come up and see me sometime.
[Jack Claton walks in]
Mmm hmm. Oh, ah, yes. Yes. Alright, good-bye.
